column6: Welcome, KatieH0105
Welcome, R
plan 1
Hey R, can you elaborate on the reason you chose plan 1 from your perspective of what would be the most economical ?
Welcome, lilikoi44
Yes
Less cost
Plan 3, provided some leeway can be made in the costs.

Hey Xile, you have proposed plan 3, and R has proposed plan 1. What do you think are the most important trade-offs between the two plans from your perspective of what would be most environmentally friendly and with lowest startup costs ?
Less cost
Hi everyone!  Was getting up to speed and reading the information.
Plan 3 nuclear energy is too high

The way I look at it, the city wants to have an environmentally friendly plant, but it does not want to pay a lot of money. It also does not have room for wind, nor does it want to effect the birds. Therefore the only real options are plan 1 or 3. I say 3 because the cost will come down over time, and it is more efficient. If the intial cost being a little higher is not ok, than plan 1 also works.
And the cost is higher
Plan 1 uses a lot of coal and endangers the desire to be carbon neutral.  I think it would be better to avoid that one.
The problem is it is the only one under budget!
ok so what plan do u have

Yeah, it is a matter of trade offs. Plan 1 violates several of the environmental standards we need to meet, but all the others are over budget. I am assuming we need to hit near budget but we can go over. Otherwise there is no talk to be had really.
I know there was concern with 2 because of the high amount of wind power even though it is closest in cost.  I was thinking about 3, but it costs even more.
2 is also a problem because of the bird population that the city is known for.
Yeah, it seems to easy to just settle on 1 because it is under budget.
Good point, yes.

column6: Ok, so do we go with 1 and stay under budget or with 3 to be more carbon neutral?
I say 3. It meets more criteria, and should come down in price after the initial plant is built
yes
I know someone has indicated plan 1 to the left, but I think plan 3 would be better.
Ok, so 3 it is.
